meanings.definition: To entrust (a task or responsibility) to another person
meanings.sent1: She delegated the project to her colleague.
meanings.sent2: The manager delegated the decision-making to the team.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully delegated the job of catching the mouse to the dog.
meanings.sent4: The teacher delegated the role of class monitor to the responsible student.
meanings.sent5: The captain delegated the task of steering the ship to the experienced sailor.

meanings.definition: Authorized to act as a representative for someone else
meanings.sent1: The delegated representative attended the meeting on behalf of the CEO.
meanings.sent2: The delegated official signed the agreement as a proxy.
meanings.sent3: The cake, being the delegated dessert, was eagerly devoured by the guests.
meanings.sent4: The star player was the team's delegated leader on the field.
meanings.sent5: The chosen delegate was delegated the important task of delivering the speech.
